validation.blacklisted: Field must not be any of the following values: {values}
validation.ipAddress: Field must be a valid IP address

ip: With IP v4 range groups you can group the SEB client connections within a IP ranges.
Every SEB client that is connected with a given client IP address that is within the
defined range (including start and end address) belongs to this group.
This is mostly useful if you have dedicated managed devices where you know
the IP ranges for e.g. your computer rooms.
os: With SEB Client groups you can group the SEB client connections within the
operating system they are running on.
For this grouping type there is a defined SEB OS type for each
supported OS; Windows, MacOS and iOS.
This is mostly useful if you want to monitor and manage
the SEB clients by different operating system types to give respective support.
alphabetical: With this group you can define an alphabetical range to collect SEB Clients by user session name.
The range is defined by an inclusive starting letter and an inclusive end letter.
There is no additional check if your defined groups covering the whole alphabet
Furthermore since the user session name can change during the SEB Connection phase, the group belonging of a SEB Client can change too.

createTemplate.info: What kind of template do you want to create?
createTemplate.configurationTemplateTeaser: In the SEB Client Template you define the SEB Settings. These are sent to the SEB clients installed on the students' devices. The SEB clients then reconfigure using these settings. The SEB Client Template is needed to set up an Exam Template.
createTemplate.examTemplateTeaser: In the Exam Template you define everything needed to prepare an exam in SEB Server. You define which SEB Settings will be used by selecting a SEB Client Template. You also define which Connection Configuration to be used. By choosing Exam Supervisors, you decide, who shall supervise the exam. You also define which indicators and which groups shall be used, when applying this Exam Template to an exam. If there is no SEB Client Template, nor a Connection Configuration, please create these first.

sebSettings.pwdMismatch: The password and confirm password must match
sebSettings.pwdSpaces: The value must not start or end with a space.

generalView.allowQuit_tooltip:
Users can quit SEB with Control-Q, window close or quit button.
Otherwise use a quit link in your exam system or shutdown/restart the computer.

view_mode.title: Browser View Mode
view_mode.0_tooltip: Use window for the SEB browser which can be scaled and moved around, also to another screen of available
view_mode.1_tooltip: Display the SEB browser full screen
view_mode.2_tooltip: Mainly to be used on Windows tablets. In Windows 10, Tablet Mode needs to be activated. Not working with the Create New Desktop kiosk mode, you have to reconfigure the SEB client settings to Disable Explorer Shell.

main_browser.title: Main Browser Window Size and Position
main_browser.width_tooltip: Window width in pixel or percentage of total screen width
main_browser.height_tooltip: Window height in pixel or percentage of total screen height

browser_window.title: Browser Window Toolbar
browser_window.enableToolbar_tooltip: Displays a toolbar on top of the browser window which can also be hidden by the user
browser_window.addrBar: Allow address bar for main window (Win)
browser_window.newAddrBar: Allow address bar for additional window (Win)
browser_window.allowDev: Show developer tools in window menu (Win)
browser_window.hideTool_tooltip: Hide browser window toolbar by default. It can be shown again by using the View menu or Alt-Command-T.
browser_window.showMenuBar_tooltip: Show the OS X menu bar to allow to access settings like Wi-Fi

task_bar.title: SEB Taskbar / Dock
task_bar.showTaskBar_tooltip: The SEB task bar shows and switches between open browser windows, allowed resources and applications and displays additional controls
task_bar.raiseHandButtonAlwaysPromptMessage_toolt: if this is enabled the raise hand function will always prompt the user to give a message for the raise hand action
task_bar.allowWlan_tooltip: Allows to reconnect to WiFi networks which have previously been connected to
task_bar.showReloadButton_tooltip: Reloads current web page. Shows warning if enabled in Browser settings tab
task_bar.showInputLanguage_tooltip: Shows current keyboard layout and allows to switch between other active keyboard layouts

zoom.title: Enable Zoom (Win/Mac)
zoom.enableZoomPage_tooltip: Pages can be zoomed with ctrl - cmd +/- or the commands in the view menu and browser window toolbar (Mac)
zoom.enableZoomText_tooltip: Text in browser windows can be zoomed with cmd +/- or the commands in the view menu and browser window toolbar (Mac)

audio.title: Audio Control
audio.enableControl_tooltip: Displays an audio control in the SEB taskbar
audio.mute_tooltip: The audio is muted when the SEB/exam starts
audio.volume_tooltip: The volume level after starting SEB/exam

spellChecker.title: Spell Checker
spellChecker.allow: Allow spell checking (Win supports English only)
spellChecker.allow_tooltip: Allow to use 'Check spelling' in the SEB browser
spellChecker.allowDict_tooltip: Allow to use the OS X dictionary lookup using a 3 finger tap

applicationView.allowSwitchToApplications: Allow switching to third party application (Mac)
applicationView.allowSwitchToApplications_tooltip:
Decreases security of the kiosk mode by allowing process switcher (Cmd+Tab).
The blacked out background of SEB also doesn't cover some alerts and modal windows in this mode.
applicationView.allowFlashFullscreen: Allow Flash to switch to fullscreen mode (Mac)

permittedProcess.active_tooltip: This permitted process item is active
permittedProcess.os_tooltip: Indicates on which operating system the permitted process runs
permittedProcess.title: Title
permittedProcess.title_tooltip:
Application title which is displayed in the application chooser.
 Background processes don't have a title, because they can't be selected by users.
permittedProcess.description_tooltip:
Optional, should explain what kind of process this is,
 because this might not be obvious only from the executable's name.
permittedProcess.executable_tooltip:
File name of the executable, which should not contain any parts of a file system path,
 only the filename of the exe file (like calc.exe).
permittedProcess.identifier_tooltip:
(Sub) string in the title of the main window of a tricky third party application (Java, Acrobat etc.).
 Mac OS X: Bundle identifier of the process in reverse domain notation.
permittedProcess.iconInTaskbar_tooltip:
Show icon of permitted application in task bar
 (not possible when 'run in background' is enabled).
permittedProcess.autostart_tooltip: Start the process automatically together with SEB
permittedProcess.runInBackground_tooltip:
Allow the permitted process to already be running when SEB starts.
 Such a process can't have an icon in the task bar.
permittedProcess.allowUserToChooseApp: Allow user to select location of application
permittedProcess.strongKill_tooltip:
Terminate process in a not-nice way,
which may cause data loss if the application had unsaved data
permittedProcess.allowOpenAndSavePanel_tooltip:
When using AAC Assessment Mode,
SEB blocks the macOS Open File and Save As panel.
Users cannot browse the file system and open files manually
in most permitted apps with AAC Multi App Mode.
permittedProcess.allowShareSheet_tooltip:
When using AAC Assessment Mode, SEB blocks the macOS share sheet.
Users cannot share documents in permitted apps with AAC Multi App Mode.
permittedProcess.allowManualStart_tooltip:
Allow user to start the additional application with its Dock icon.
Otherwise the app can be started by downloading and opening its documents
permittedProcess.allowNetworkAccess_tooltip: Allow the permitted app in AAC Multi App Mode to access the network/internet
permittedProcess.teamIdentifier_tooltip: Team identifier of the app's code signature

prohibitedProcess.active_tooltip: Indicates if this prohibited process item is active
prohibitedProcess.description_tooltip:
Optional, to explain what kind of process this is,
 because this might not be obvious only from the executable's name.
prohibitedProcess.executable_tooltip:
File name of the executable, which should not contain any parts of a file system path,
 only the filename of the exe file (like calc.exe).
prohibitedProcess.identifier_tooltip:
Title of the main window of a Java third party application.
 Mac OS X: Bundle identifier of the process in reverse domain notation.
prohibitedProcess.strongKill_tooltip:
Terminate process in a not-nice way,
which may cause data loss if the application had unsaved data
prohibitedProcess.ignoreAAC_tooltip:
When using the AAC kiosk mode
(which prevents network and screen access for other processes),
ignore this prohibited process

networkView.ExceptionsList: Bypass proxy settings for these hosts and domains

main.testTooltip: Test run is only activated when exam is Up Coming
main.monitorTooltip: Monitoring is only activated when exam is running
main.noSEBSettings:
This Exam has no SEB settings attached yet.
Please attach an Exam Configuration with SEB settings first.
main.activeSEBClientsNote: There are currently active SEB clients connected to this exam. Therefore it is not possible to change the SEB Settings. Please make sure there are no active SEB clients connected to the Exam before edit the SEB Setting.
main.archiveTooltip: Archiving is only activated when exam is finished
